transcripts.text: Weeks ago, I briefed the media and testified in Congress that our immigration system was at the breaking point.  That breaking point has arrived.
Thousands of immigrants from Central America are currently traveling together en route to the United States.  Most of those making the journey are traveling by foot.
All right, the numbers tell you the story.  There are believed to be more crossings in just the last month here than in any month in over a decade.
This is the border fence between Mexico and the United States.  Migrants from the newly arriving caravans in Tijuana scaling the steel railings.
The system is well beyond capacity and remains at a breaking point.
Crisis is the word so many are now using to describe the border.  But now we need more than words.  It's time to act.
